title: Access not existing member vector: no type for expr in fcx

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Accessing self.not_exsisting_vector[self.not_existing + self.also_not_existing] fails as it should, but it also panics, which it should not.

I tried this code (http://is.gd/S6oqIh):

```
struct Foo;
impl Foo {
    pub fn create_a_mess(&self) {
        self.not_existing_vector[self.i + self.a];
    }
}
fn main() {}
```

I expected to see this happen: Just complain that the member did not exist, not panic.

Instead, this happened:

```
<anon>:5:9: 5:33 error: attempted access of field `not_existing_vector` on type `&Foo`, but no field with that name was found
<anon>:5         self.not_existing_vector[self.i + self.a];

                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
error: internal compiler error: no type for expr in fcx 0x7f1af37ecff0
```
## Meta

```
rustc 1.0.0-nightly (f207ecbe0 2015-04-03) (built 2015-04-03)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: f207ecbe021e2a81fbff4ea1904b955a156aa340
commit-date: 2015-04-03
build-date: 2015-04-03
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.0.0-nightly
```
